sex.translation[0].definitions[0].defini: the physical activity that two people do together in order to produce babies, or for pleasure
sex.translation[0].definitions[0].exampl: All you see on TV is sex and violence these days.
They had sex in the back seat of his car.
She no longer wanted to have sex with him.
the dangers of casual sex (=having sex with someone without intending to have a serious relationship)
sex.translation[0].definitions[1].defini: whether a person, plant, or animal is male or female
sex.translation[0].definitions[1].exampl: Put your name and sex at the top of the form.
sex.translation[0].definitions[2].defini: all men, considered as a group, or all women, considered as a group
sex.translation[0].definitions[2].exampl: He found it difficult to talk to members of the opposite sex (=people that were not his own sex).
People of both sexes (=both men and women) buy her records.
sex.translation[1].definitions[0].defini: to find out whether an animal is male or female
